doc.after: Economists like Milton Friedman have strongly criticised the efficiency of democracy They base this on their premise of the irrational voter Their argument is that voters are highly uninformed about many political issues especially relating to economics and have a strong bias about the few issues on which they are fairly knowledgeable A common example often quoted to substantiate this point is the high economic development achieved by China a non democratic country as compared to India a democratic country citation needed
